[[Image:MagareyMedal1929.JPG|frame|right|1929 Magarey Medal won by [[Robert Snell]]]]
 
'''The Magarey Medal''' is an [[Australian rules football]] award, awarded annually since 1898 to the fairest and most brilliant player in the Home and Away season of the [[South Australian National Football League]] (SANFL), as judged by the field umpires. The award was created by [[William Ashley Magarey]], then chairman of the league.
'''The Magarey Medal''' is an [[Australian rules football]] award, awarded annually since 1898 to the fairest and most brilliant player in the Home and Away season of the [[South Australian National Football League]] (SANFL), as judged by the field umpires. The award was created by [[William Ashley Magarey]], then chairman of the league.
Line 6: Line 5:
After each match, the three field umpires (those umpires who control the flow of the game) confer and award 3, 2 and 1 points to the players they regard as the best, second best and third best during the match.
After each match, the three field umpires (those umpires who control the flow of the game) confer and award 3, 2 and 1 points to the players they regard as the best, second best and third best during the match.
If a player is suspended for a reportable offence during the season, they become ineligible to win the award.
If a player is suspended for a reportable offence during the season, they become ineligible to win the award.
